page.title: 09Heating in Alburgh
page.content: { Heating There is no mains gas supply in the village, so domestic heating and cooking burns alternative fuels. Solid fuel,wood and coal are still widely used in open fires in the living room. It is also used for biolers and ovens in the kitchens. Electrity, thought by many to be clean but expensive is used in many kitchens for cooking, some houses also heat the rooms using electic fires or central heating while others prefer oil to burn in a central heating boiler. Calor gas is used for cooking,deliveries are made to the village. This can also be used for central heating - the school is heated in this way and many farm use bulk deliveries of calour gas to heat their chicken houses.
